snippet: Since the killing of 49 exotic animals set loose in Ohio last year, officials are moving to better regulate the business, raising concerns among traders and owners.
abstract: Officials are moving to better regulate the selling and breeding of exotic animals, raising concerns among traders and owners; action comes in wake of the killing of 49 exotic animals set loose in Zanesville, Ohio, in 2011; animal activist groups had been outraged that the types of animals in the Zanesville menagerie could even be obtained as pets.
lead_paragraph: Since the killing of 49 exotic animals set loose in Ohio last year, officials are moving to better regulate the business, raising concerns among traders and owners.

headline.main: A Tighter Leash on Exotic Pets
headline.print_headline: A Tighter Leash On Exotic Pets

keywords.value: Humane Society of the United States
keywords.name: organizations
